snippet: The death toll stood at 131, but officials estimated 300 people were missing after a mudslide engulfed a neighborhood, and by Sunday, little hope remained that anyone would be found alive.
abstract: Rescue workers continue to work at site of mudslide in Santa Catarina Pinula, Guatemala, country's worst natural disaster in years; authorities have been warning since 2008 that neighborhood of El Cambray II, which was demolished by mudslide that has so far claimed 131 lives, was unsafe.

byline.original: By NIC WIRTZ and ELISABETH MALKIN
byline.contributor: Nic Wirtz reported from Santa Catarina Pinula, and Elisabeth Malkin from Mexico City.

lead_paragraph: The death toll stood at 131, but officials estimated 300 people were missing after a mudslide engulfed a neighborhood, and by Sunday, little hope remained that anyone would be found alive.

headline.main: Hundreds Missing in Guatemala as Landslide Cleanup Begins
headline.print_headline: Hundreds Still Missing After Guatemala Mudslide
